title: Is a Bankruptcy Court Appeal in District Court Appealed to the Ninth Circuit or Ninth Circuit BAP?
question: Is a Bankruptcy Court Appeal in District Court Appealed to the Ninth Circuit or Ninth Circuit BAP?
answers:
You have the option of appealing the District Court or to the BAP. It's up to you; one or the other.

If that doesn't result in what you need, your next appeal is to the 9th Cir Court of Appeals.

I hope you are not considering any bankruptcy appeal without a lawyer, but that is what your question suggests. The BAP means Bankruptcy Appellate Panel. It is part of the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeal. It is located at: 125 South Grand Avenue, Pasadena, CA 91105, (626) 229 - 7220.

The U.S. Bankruptcy Appellate Panel (BAP) for the Ninth Circuit was originally established by the Judicial Council of the Ninth Circuit in 1979 as an alternative forum to the district courts for hearing bankruptcy appeals. All district courts within the Ninth Circuit have issued general orders providing for the automatic referral of bankruptcy appeals to the BAP for disposition.
